content.description: A interesting yet contrived route starting under the roof with a line of bolts to the left of the corner. Start under the roof, (probably want gear unless you stick clip the first bolt) undercling out to stance to clip first bolt. Then follow line of bolts making weird moves, resisting the urge to go right into the corner. The anchor is shared with “Rolling Rock”.
content.protection: A few small pieces for the roof or stick clip first bolt, 4 bolts
content.location: Start under the obvious roof with small undercling crack in it. Follow the bolts.

content.description: Cool moves using an arete and small edges on interesting rock leads past bolts to a small overlap and bolted anchor.
content.location: To the right of “the ledge” and the left of an obvious right facing corner in the middle of the cliff.

content.description: Steep broken rock leads to a scooped top out and a thought provoking crux.
content.protection: Gear from .2- BD #1 two bolt anchor on top
content.location: This route is found on the far left side of "The Ledge"

content.description: Starting at ground level climb the corner to the tho of "the ledge". Continue up on thin cracks and flakes placing gear as you go. This route is not run out but good gear placements are essential. climb up to the single bolt and figure out the crux. Climb to shared anchor with "Chronomancer"
content.protection: Thin stoppers and cams from .2-BD#3, one bolt, bolted anchor
content.location: Directly above the corner that is the approach to "the Ledge". Look for the single bolt up high on the route.

content.description: Funky balance moves down low bring you to a small ledge. Figure you your way through the overlap and up the face above to the chains.
content.location: this climb starts on "the ledge" in the center of the cliff is a line of bolts with a small ledge and overlap.

content.description: Short cliff with mostly great rock quality. There are seven routes here ranging from 5.8 to 10C, the longest being around 50 feet.
